step.context: \int_{0}^{1} \dfrac{2x +3 }{5x^2 +1}\, dx = \overbrace{\int_{0}^{1} \dfrac{2x\, dx}{5x^2 +1}}^{X} + \overbrace{\int_{0}^{1} \dfrac{3\, dx }{5x^2 +1}}^{Y}\\ \text{Now, if}\int_{0}^{1}\dfrac{2x\,dx}{5x^2 +1} \xrightarrow{t = 5x^2 +1}M\int_{m}^{n}\dfrac{dt}{t}\text{ then}\\ \text{what are M, m and n =?}
step.reason: \text{If }t = 5x^2 + 1, \text{ then }dt = 10x\, dx\\ \implies \dfrac{dt}{5} = 2x\, dx\\ \therefore \int \dfrac{2x}{5x^2 +1}\,dx = \underbrace{\dfrac{1}{5}}_{M}\int \dfrac{dt}{t}\\ \text{Also, }t = 1 \left(x =0\right)\text{ and }t = 6 \left(x = 1\right)\\ \text{So. }\int_{0}^{1}\dfrac{2x}{5x^2 +1}\, dx = \dfrac{1}{5}\int_{1}^{6}\dfrac{dt}{t}\\ \implies M= \dfrac{1}{5}, m=1\text{ and }n=6\\
